      • init

        public abstract Behavior<T> init(ActorContext<T> ctx)
        Invoked when the actor is created (or re-created on restart) this is where a restarter implementation can provide logic for dealing with exceptions thrown when running any actor initialization logic (undeferring).

        Note that the logic must take care to not wrap StoppedBehavior to avoid creating zombie behaviors that keep running although stopped.

        Parameters:
        ctx - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        The initial behavior of the actor after undeferring if needed

      • receiveSignal

        public Behavior<T> receiveSignal(ActorContext<T> ctx,
                                 Signal signal)
        Description copied from class: ExtensibleBehavior
        Process an incoming Signal and return the next behavior. This means that all lifecycle hooks, ReceiveTimeout, Terminated and Failed messages can initiate a behavior change.

        The returned behavior can in addition to normal behaviors be one of the canned special objects:

        * returning stopped will terminate this Behavior * returning same designates to reuse the current Behavior * returning unhandled keeps the same Behavior and signals that the message was not yet handled

        Code calling this method should use Behavior$ canonicalize to replace the special objects with real Behaviors.

        Specified by:
        receiveSignal in class ExtensibleBehavior<T>
        Parameters:
        ctx - (undocumented)
        signal - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

        Description copied from class: ExtensibleBehavior
        Process an incoming message and return the next behavior.

        The returned behavior can in addition to normal behaviors be one of the canned special objects:

        * returning stopped will terminate this Behavior * returning same designates to reuse the current Behavior * returning unhandled keeps the same Behavior and signals that the message was not yet handled

        Code calling this method should use Behavior$ canonicalize to replace the special objects with real Behaviors.
